definition[0]: the activity or sport of running
example[0]: Did you go running this morning?
example[1]: New facilities include a pool and a running track.
definition[1]: the way in which an organization or system is managed or organized
example[3]: He has little say in the running of the company.
definition[2]: to have some hope or no hope of winning something
example[4]: Two European aircraft builders are in the running for the contract.
note[0]: be in the running/out of the running for
definition[3]: an argument etc that continues or is repeated over a long period of time
example[5]: the running debate over taxes and growth
definition[4]: a total that is continually increased as new costs, amounts etc are added
example[6]: We have been keeping a running total of layoff announcements by major corporations.
definition[5]: a machine that is in running order is working correctly
example[7]: They had failed to keep the crane in running order.
definition[6]: the order in which the different parts of an event have been arranged to take place
example[8]: The running order had to be changed at the last minute.
definition[7]: small repairs that you do to a machine to keep it working
